newsitem.title: ITALY: ITALIAN SOCCER FAN GETS FIVE-YEAR BAN FOR RACISM.
newsitem.headline: ITALIAN SOCCER FAN GETS FIVE-YEAR BAN FOR RACISM.

text.p: A soccer fan who led racist chants during a match in the northeastern Italian town of Padua has been banned from attending matches for the next five years, police said on Wednesday.
The city's police chief imposed the ban on the 21-year-old supporter of second division side Padova after racist abuse was shouted at black players during a match last weekend against Cesena.
Racist slogans were also daubed on the walls of the club's headquarters last month after a home match against Brescia. Police would not name the fan, citing security reasons.
